title: What is the prize for winning X Factor: Celebrity?
text:
The Chace’s Jenny Ryan made a splash last week – could she be in with a chance of winning? (Picture: Dymond/Thames/Syco/REX)

X Factor: Celebrity continues tonight, 19 October, with the second episode of the spin-off competition show seeing more singing celebs going head to head.

Last week, we saw the likes of The Chace’s Jenny Ryan (aka The Vixen) and Love Island alums The Islanders make a big impression on the judges.

This week, we’ll be treated to performances by even more stars, including Corrie’s Victoria Ekanoye and Love Actually’s Olivia Olson.

With these high profile contestants entering the fray, let’s take a look at what they’re fighting to win…

What does the winning act on X Factor: Celebrity get?

The winner of X Factor: Celebrity will score a record deal with Syco, Simon Cowell’s record company, and the chance to pursue a professional career in music.

Advertisement

Advertisement

The competition has already presented us with some strong contenders, with Jenny Ryan owning the stage with her rendition of Queen’s Somebody to Love.

The Islanders, comprised of Wes Nelson, Samira Mighty, Zara McDermott and Eyal Booker, got judges Nicole Scherzinger and Louis Walsh bopping in their seats.

Simon meanwhile offered the group constructive praise by saying: ‘I think for a first audition, bearing in mind where you came from, it was a good performance but it’s finding your distinct sound.’

At this stage in the competition however, with episode two due to air in a matter of hours, there’s no telling which way the wind will blow and who will emerge from the competition victorious.

On the subject of the type of sound we can expect from her, Olivia Olsen told Metro.co.uk: ‘I’m a jazz and blues singer at the core, but I’ve also got a bit of an edge too, so I don’t know how you would explain that. I want to do something new.’

She also spoke about the high stakes of the show, telling us: ‘I didn’t think I’d be as nervous as I was. When you step up there it hits you in the face how real it is and how badly you want it. We were really excited about it – “What a fun opportunity!”

‘Then you get up there and it’s like, “This is really my moment to prove myself.”’

The X Factor: Celebrity contestants OVERS Journalist: Martin Bashir Talk Show host: Ricki Lake Quiz show champion: Jenny Ryan Actress: Victoria Ekanoye UNDERS Reality star: Megan McKenna Model and Actress: Hayley Hasselhoff Soap star: Jonny Labey Film star: Olivia Olson Actor: Kevin McHale GROUPS The Islanders: Samira Mighty, Zara McDermott, Wes Nelson and Eyal Booker Try Star: Ben Foden, Thom Evans and Levi Davis Cole and Edwards: Brendan Cole and Jeremy Edwards Social Media Stars and CBBC Presenters Max and Harvey V5: Sofia, Alondra, Laura, Wendii and Natalie

The X Factor: Celebrity airs on ITV on Saturdays.

description: X Factor: Celebrity continues tonight,. With high profile contestants entering the fray, let's take a look at what they're fighting to win.
